metadata.description: 500 high-quality explicit temporal scope pairs WITH temporal words. Designed for training temporal horizon detection.
metadata.validation: Pre-validated for temporal keyword presence, structural balance, and clear temporal distinction

pairs.question: When developing a roadmap for this initiative, consider:
pairs.immediate: (b) What we can deliver in the next 30 days
pairs.long_term: (a) What position we want in 10 years

pairs.question: The planning horizon for this project should be:
pairs.immediate: (a) This sprint cycle ending next week
pairs.long_term: (b) The full product lifecycle over years

pairs.question: When setting milestones, focus on:
pairs.immediate: (b) Daily and weekly checkpoint targets this month

pairs.question: The timeline we should optimize for is:
pairs.immediate: (a) The next few hours and days

pairs.question: The schedule should be driven by:
The project plan emphasizes:
pairs.immediate: (a) Shipping deliverables by this Friday deadline
pairs.long_term: (b) Building value that lasts for generations

pairs.question: When drafting the plan, consider:
pairs.immediate: (a) What's achievable by end of day

pairs.question: Sprint planning concentrates on:
pairs.immediate: (a) Tasks completable by this afternoon deadline

pairs.question: The planning cycle operates on:
pairs.immediate: (b) Daily standup rhythms and weekly checkpoints

pairs.question: Contingency planning addresses:
pairs.immediate: (a) Risks that could materialize tomorrow morning
pairs.long_term: (b) Threats emerging over the coming decades

pairs.question: When making this choice, consider:
pairs.long_term: (b) What's wise for years to come

pairs.question: Optimal decisions maximize:
pairs.immediate: (a) Utility in the next few hours

pairs.question: Decision speed should match:
pairs.immediate: (a) The urgency of this moment's deadline
pairs.long_term: (b) The importance for future decades ahead

pairs.question: When faced with uncertainty, choose:
pairs.immediate: (b) What works for the current situation
pairs.long_term: (a) What remains robust over many years

pairs.question: The decision timeframe spans:
pairs.immediate: (a) Minutes to hours of consideration today

pairs.question: The decision analysis covers:
pairs.immediate: (a) This month's data points and metrics

pairs.question: When diagnosing the issue, look at:
pairs.immediate: (b) What broke in the last hour

pairs.question: Problem resolution focuses on:
pairs.immediate: (b) Stopping the bleeding right now today
pairs.long_term: (a) Eliminating root causes for years ahead

pairs.question: The debugging effort addresses:
pairs.long_term: (a) Systemic weaknesses over the coming years

pairs.question: Problem ownership spans:
pairs.immediate: (a) The current shift rotation this week
pairs.long_term: (b) The product's entire lifecycle over years

pairs.question: When solving complex issues, think:
pairs.immediate: (a) What can we ship by tonight's deadline
pairs.long_term: (b) What architecture serves us for decades

pairs.question: Issue tracking covers:
pairs.immediate: (a) This sprint's open tickets this week

pairs.question: Problem communication addresses:
pairs.immediate: (a) Current status right now this hour

pairs.question: The most important thing right now is:
When ranking tasks, consider:
pairs.immediate: (a) What's due in the next hour

pairs.question: When everything feels urgent, focus on:
When reasoning through problems, consider:
pairs.long_term: (b) What will remain true over time

pairs.question: Accept the tradeoff that:
pairs.immediate: (b) Pays off by end of day

pairs.question: The compromise point shifts based on:
When goals conflict, prioritize:
pairs.long_term: (a) The one mattering most over time

pairs.question: The action bias favors:
pairs.long_term: (a) Doing the right thing over time
